sen.j: 大原家（おおはらけ）は宇多源氏の流れを引く源氏堂上源氏。
sen.e: The Ohara family is a member of Genji Tosho Genji (the Minamoto clan members who are court nobles above a certain rank), who is a descendant of Uda-Genji (the Minamoto clan).
The Ohara family was a member of Genji Tosho Genji (the Minamoto clan members who were court nobles above a certain rank), a descendant of Uda-Genji (the Minamoto clan).
The Ohara family was a member of Genji Tosho Genji (Minamoto clan members who were court nobles above a certain rank), descendants of Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 用語集の沿って the Minamoto clan →Minamoto clan, 他のファイルの修正に沿って a descendant → descendants

sen.j: 江戸時代に庭田重条（にわた しげなが）（従一位・大納言）（1650年～1725年）の養子大原栄敦（おおはら ひであつ）（正三位・近衛府）（1704年～1758年）を祖とする。
sen.e: Its patriarch was Hideatsu OHARA (Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), Konoefu (member of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards)) (1704 - 1758), who was adopted by Shigenaga NIWATA (Juichii (Junior First Rank), Dainagon (chief councilor of state)) (1650 - 1725).

Its patriarch was Hideatsu OHARA (Shosanmi - Senior Third Rank), Konoefu (member of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) (1704 - 1758), adopted by Shigenaga NIWATA (Juichii - Junior First Rank), Dainagon (chief councilor of state) (1650 - 1725).

Its patriarch was Hideatsu OHARA (Shosanmi - Senior Third Rank), Konoefu (member of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) (1704 - 1758), adopted by Shigenaga NIWATA (Juichii - Junior First Rank), Dainagon (chief councilor of state) (1650 - 1725).
The family rank was Urinke (family of court nobles whose members were allowed to be promoted to higher court positions).
sen.cmt: 羽林家 定訳不明、意味未確認
sen.e: The family rank was Urinke (family of court nobles whose members were allowed to be promoted to higher court positions).
The family rank was the House of Urin.

sen.j: 大原栄敦（ひであつ）の子大原重度（しげたび）（1725年～1793年）以降は中納言を極官とする。
sen.e: After Hideatsu OHARA's son, Shigetabi OHARA (1725 - 1793), the highest court position appointed was Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
After Hideatsu OHARA's son, Shigetabi OHARA (1725 - 1793), the highest court position appointed was Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
After Hideatsu OHARA's son, Shigetabi OHARA (1725 - 1793), the highest court position appointed was Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: 幕末には大原重徳が尊攘派公卿として活躍した。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, Shigetomi OHARA was active as a kugyo (court noble) of sonjo party (the royalist party).
At the end of the Edo period, Shigetomi OHARA was active as a kugyo (court noble) of the sonjo party (the royalist party).
At the end of the Edo period, Shigetomi OHARA was active as a kugyo (court noble) of the sonjo party (the royalist party).
As their family profession, the family served as performers of sacred music and dance at shrines.
As their family profession, the family served as performers of sacred music and dance at shrines.
As their family profession, the family served as performers of sacred music and dance at shrines.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 30 koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was thirty koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was thirty koku.

sen.j: 明治以降は大原重徳の功績により伯爵。
sen.e: Due to Shigetomi OHARA's achievements the family was given a status of a count after the Meiji period.
Due to Shigetomi OHARA's achievements the family was given a status of count after the Meiji period.
Due to Shigetomi OHARA's achievements the family was given a status of count after the Meiji period.
